paper_metadata.title: ADB East Asia Working Paper Series

program_information.program_name: ADB-funded pilot project for poverty reduction

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The pilot project successfully mobilized the local villagers, and developed the essential rural infrastructure comprising water supply, village roads, irrigation and flood control, and electricity.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The farmers have better houses, new sources of income, more household assets (TV sets, and mobile telephones) and reduced income poverty.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This paper summarizes the PRC's national poverty reduction strategies and highlights a case study of an ADB-funded pilot project in Nayong County

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This paper summarizes the PRC's national poverty reduction strategies and highlights a case study of an ADB-funded pilot project in Nayong County of Guizhou Province in the PRC.
evidence_citations.country_citation: Over the past 3 decades, the majority of the population has been lifted from poverty in the People's Republic of China (PRC).
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The PRC's poverty reduction strategies have focused on providing poverty reduction opportunities by building and transferring assets to the poor in rural poverty-stricken areas.
